meanings.definition: To remove by cutting or excising.
meanings.sent1: She was exsecting the damaged part of the plant with precision.
meanings.sent2: The surgeon was exsecting the tumor from the patient's body.
meanings.sent3: The chef exsected the burnt edges of the toast, turning it into a masterpiece.
meanings.sent4: With each stroke of the knife, he exsected the old memories from his mind.
meanings.sent5: The sculptor exsected the excess clay to reveal the hidden beauty within.

meanings.definition: The act of cutting out or excising.
meanings.sent1: The exsecting of the tumor was a delicate procedure.
meanings.sent2: The exsecting of the damaged tissue helped in the healing process.
meanings.sent3: The exsecting of the cake slice left everyone amazed at the precision.
meanings.sent4: The exsecting of the paragraph from the document changed its entire meaning.
meanings.sent5: The exsecting of the old tree branches revealed a clear view of the sky.
